title: Cantal
text:
Ingredients
Yield: 2 pounds


9L full cream pasteuirzed milk
1/4 t of Mesophilic Culture, or 4 T mesophilic mother culture
2.5ml (1/2 t) liquid rennet in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water (or 1/4 rennet table)
2 T kosher salt
cheese mold
cheese cloth
cheese box
colander
large bowl for whey
large bowl for mixing in salt
weights

title: Cantal
text:
Heat milk to (30C)

1/4 t of Mesophilic Culture, or 4 T mesophilic mother culture
prepare 2.5ml (1/2 t) liquid rennet in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water

title: Cantal
section: Sprinkle on mesophilic culture, leave for 2 mins
text: Sprinkle on mesophilic culture, leave for 2 mins

title: Cantal
section: Stir, cover, and ripen for 15 mins at 30C
text: Stir, cover, and ripen for 15 mins at 30C

title: Cantal
section: Add rennet and stir for 1 minute
text: Add rennet and stir for 1 minute

title: Cantal
section: Cover, and keep at 30C for 1 hour or until clean break
text: Cover, and keep at 30C for 1 hour or until clean break

title: Cantal
text:
Cut curds into 1/4 inch cubes

Use a wisk to cut pieces you miss

title: Cantal
text: Let sit (covered) for 5 mins

title: Cantal
section: Pour curds and whey through a cheese cloth lined colander
text:
Pour curds and whey through a cheese cloth lined colander

keep warm while it drain (about 20 mins)

title: Cantal
section: Break curds into several pieces and put into a cheese basket lined with cheese cloth
text: Break curds into several pieces and put into a cheese basket lined with cheese cloth

title: Cantal
text: Press at 2.4-4.5kg for 12 hours

title: Cantal
section: Flip and press for 12 more hours
text:
Flip and press for 12 more hours

at same weight (2.4-4.5kg).

title: Cantal
section: In a large bowl, mill (break up) the cheese into 1-inch pieces.
text: In a large bowl, mill (break up) the cheese into 1-inch pieces.

title: Cantal
section: Add 2 T kosher salt and mix well
text:
Add 2 T kosher salt and mix well

knead with your fingers

title: Cantal
text: Rinse the mold and cloth

title: Cantal
section: Place the cheese in the mold lined with cloth
text: Place the cheese in the mold lined with cloth

title: Cantal
text:
Press at 10-20kg for 2-3 days

flipping every day

title: Cantal
section: Remove and let air-try at room temp for 2-3 days
text:
Remove and let air-try at room temp for 2-3 days

flipping every 6 hours

title: Cantal
text:
When dry to touch

Age at 10-13C and 80-85%RH for 3-6 months.
flip the cheese and wipe the rind with brine twice a week

title: About
text: About this site

title: Cheese-recipes
text:
Gruyere
Cantal
Gouda
Saturated Brine Solution

title: Saturated Brine Solution
text:
Ingredients


1 fresh raw egg (for testing density)
2L non-chlorinated water
450g non-iodised salt (225g/L)
2T white vinegar (I assume normal strength)
1t (5ml) calcium chloride solution

title: Saturated Brine Solution
section: Put the water into a saucepan
text:
Put the water into a saucepan

can warm the water to help the salt disolve

title: Saturated Brine Solution
text: Add the egg

title: Saturated Brine Solution
section: Add the salt (non-iodised) until the egg floats
text:
Add the salt (non-iodised) until the egg floats

Add more salt if you want it more salty

title: Saturated Brine Solution
section: move the brine to a container and allow to cool
text:
move the brine to a container and allow to cool

get out the calcium chloride, vinegar, teaspoon, and tablespoon

title: Saturated Brine Solution
text: Stir in 1t calcium chloride (5ml)

title: Saturated Brine Solution
text: Stir in 2T vinegar

title: Saturated Brine Solution
section: Store in cheese cave or fridge
text: Store in cheese cave or fridge

title: Gouda
text:
Ingredients

10L full cream milk
1/8th t (dash) of Mesophilic Culture (MO30)
2.5ml (1/2 t) calcium chloride in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water
2.5ml (1/2 t) liquid rennet in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water
Saturated Brine Solution

calcium chloride
salt

cheese wax or vacumme bag
ladle
container for whey
seive
bamboo mat for drying

title: Gouda
text:
Put milk on the heat (29C)

measure 1/8th t (dash) of Mesophilic Culture (MO30)
prepare 2.5ml (1/2 t) calcium chloride in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water
prepare 2.5ml (1/2 t) liquid rennet in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water

title: Gouda
text:
Add mesophilic culture

also add a little kifir

title: Gouda
section: Let it sit for a couple mins then stir in
text: Let it sit for a couple mins then stir in

title: Gouda
text:
Stir calcium chloride

If using unpasturised milk
2.5ml (1/2 t) calcium chloride in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water

title: Gouda
text:
Add rennet

2.5ml (1/2 t) liquid rennet in 1/4 cup non-chlorinated water
stir no more than 1min

title: Gouda
section: Let sit until clean break (30-40 mins)
text:
Let sit until clean break (30-40 mins)

mine took 1h15mins

title: Gouda
section: Cut curds into half inch cubes
text: Cut curds into half inch cubes

title: Gouda
text:
Let sit (covered) for 5 mins

prepare some non-chlorinated water at 60C, at least 3L.

title: Gouda
text: Stir for 5 mins

title: Gouda
text:
Let sit for 5 mins

prepare some non-chlorinated water at 60C, at least 3L.

title: Gouda
section: Using a sieve, ladle out 4 cups (1L) of whey
text:
Using a sieve, ladle out 4 cups (1L) of whey

sieve keeps the curds out of the cup.

title: Gouda
text:
Replace 4 cups of 60C water

target temp is 33C.

title: Gouda
text: Stir gently for 10 mins

title: Gouda
text:
Let settle for 5-10 mins

reduce temp of water to 45C.

title: Gouda
section: Note the level of the whey
text:
Note the level of the whey

there may be a level of curds on the side of the pot.

title: Gouda
section: Ladle out the whey to the level of the curds
text: Ladle out the whey to the level of the curds

title: Gouda
section: Stir, then add 45C water to the level that the whey was
text:
Stir, then add 45C water to the level that the whey was

temperature should be 37C

title: Gouda
text:
Stir for 20 mins

do we maintain temperature? I think yes

title: Gouda
text: Let rest for 10 mins

title: Gouda
section: Drain out the whey, putting the curds into a cheese cloth lined mold
text: Drain out the whey, putting the curds into a cheese cloth lined mold

title: Gouda
text: Press at 10kg for 30 mins

title: Gouda
section: Flip and press at 13kg for 12 hours
text: Flip and press at 13kg for 12 hours

title: Gouda
text:
Put into brine for 12 hours

flip the cheese half way through
can trim off any weird bits first

title: Gouda
section: Air dry on bamboo cheese mat for 2-3 days until touch dry
text:
Air dry on bamboo cheese mat for 2-3 days until touch dry

turn at least every day

title: Gouda
text: vacuum seal

title: Gouda
section: mature at 10-12C for at least 6 weeks
text: mature at 10-12C for at least 6 weeks
